meanings.definition: Something that persuades or influences someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The promise of a reward can be a strong inducement for good behavior.
meanings.sent2: She offered him an inducement to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: The inducement of free pizza motivated the team to work harder.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to travel abroad was the inducement he needed to take the job.
meanings.sent5: The inducement of a bonus encouraged employees to meet their targets.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing about or causing something to happen.
meanings.sent1: The inducement of rain led to the cancellation of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent2: His speech was the inducement for change in the organization.
meanings.sent3: The magician's inducement of laughter made the audience enjoy the show even more.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's enthusiasm was the inducement for students to participate actively.
meanings.sent5: The music served as the inducement for everyone to start dancing.
